definition[0]: very close to not being acceptable
example[0]: In borderline cases, the student’s coursework is considered, as well as exam grades.
definition[1]: having qualities of both one situation, state etc and another more extreme situation or state
example[2]: a borderline schizophrenic  (=someone who has some signs of being mentally ill)
definition[2]: the point at which one quality, situation, emotion etc ends and another begins
example[3]: She slipped over the borderline into sleep.
example[4]: I was on the borderline between a first- and a second-class degree.
